entries.title: Our Planet’s Future: Combatting Climate Change
entries.description: 2022 was another catastrophic year of extreme weather events fueled by climate change. NBC News correspondent Jacob Soboroff takes a look back at the impacts of those events and looks forward as the world rallies to fight climate change.

entries.title: Car bombing in Pakistan capital kills police officer, two suspects
entries.description: A car bombing in a residential area of Islamabad, Pakistan, has left two suspects and one police officer dead. The blast happened at a checkpoint when officers attempted a body search of two suspects, a man and a woman. The deputy police chief lauded the officers’ bravery, saying that their actions saved the lives of many more.

entries.title: Suspected gunman arrested after killing at least three in Paris
entries.description: At least three people were killed and several others injured after a gunman opened fire on a busy street in central Paris, a French prosecutor said. Authorities have launched an investigation into the shooting are working to determine the suspect’s motive.

entries.title: Suicide bombing in Pakistan's capital kills 2 suspects and a policeman
entries.description: A powerful car bomb detonated in a residential area in Pakistan’s capital on Friday, killing two suspected militants and a police officer, police said, raising

entries.title: Putin downplays Patriot missile defense system after Zelenskyy’s trip to Washington
entries.description: Following Ukrainian President Zelenskyy’s high-profile trip to the U.S., Russian President Vladimir Putin downplayed the Patriot missile defense system that the White House is planning to supply to Ukraine. NBC News’ Matt Bradley explains what Putin said about ending the war and how people in Ukraine are preparing for the holidays.

entries.title: At least two killed in Paris shooting
entries.description: At least two people were killed and four wounded in a shooting in central Paris, a judicial source close to the investigation told NBC News Friday.    Two of

entries.title: North Korea fires missiles amid tension over Russia arms aid

entries.title: Serial killer Charles ‘The Serpent' Sobhraj freed from Nepal prison
entries.description: Charles Sobhraj, a convicted killer who police say is responsible for a string of murders in the 1970s and 1980s, was released from a Nepal prison on Friday

entries.title: American couple charged with child trafficking in Uganda in foster child case
entries.description: A Ugandan court has charged an American couple with child trafficking in a case that might see them serve life in prison if convicted.

entries.title: Convicted killer 'The Serpent' killer to be released
entries.description: French serial killer Charles Sobhraj is set to be released from prison in Nepal where he was serving time for murdering an American backpacker in 1975. NBC News’ Valerie Castro has more on how the killer known as “The Serpent” will be free once more.

entries.title: Convicted killer 'The Serpent' to be released
entries.description: French serial killer Charles Sobhraj is set to be released from prison in Nepal where he was serving time for murdering an American backpacker in 1975. NBC News’ Valerie Castro has more on how the killer known as “The Serpent” will be free once more.

entries.title: Celebrating 150 years of baseball in Japan
entries.description: The year of 2022 marks a special anniversary of 150 years of baseball in Japan. NBC News’ Jake Ward reports on how an increasing number of the country’s biggest stars are now playing in the MLB, teaching Americans more about the Japanese perspective on the game.
